title: How to Make a Slipknot Mask

steps.headline: Get something the size of your head.
steps.description: (Maybe a mannequin head, or if you don't have one, try using a balloon. Measure the circumference of the widest part of your head, and inflate a balloon to widest part's circumference of the balloon being that, plus about 5 cm. (2 inches.)

steps.headline: Put a clean, woman's stocking/pantihoses on the head/balloon.
After that put duct tape around it.
steps.description: (Thick masking tape still works, but duct tape is better.)

steps.headline: Cut a slit up halfway on the back of the mask and take it off.
Cut out the eye, mouth, and nose holes out.
Spray paint it green or gray for the old mask, and white, off-white or yellow for the 2008 mask.
Put in rope and tie in knot.

tyn: Duct tape (recommended) or thick masking tape
Mannequin head/balloon (or something about the size of your head)

Put a clean, woman's stocking/pantihoses on the head/balloon.  After that put duct tape around it. (Thick masking tape still works, but duct tape is better.) Cut a slit up halfway on the back of the mask and take it off.  Cut out the eye, mouth, and nose holes out.  Spray paint it green or gray for the old mask, and white, off-white or yellow for the 2008 mask.  Cut holes for dreads. (Only for the old mask.) Put in rope and tie in knot. (Only for the old mask.) Attach Velcro straps to back.
